docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct 9.-- Student disturbances, similar to those which preceded the overthrow of the government last year, have been renewed in Argentina, it was revealed today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct 9.-- Student disturbances, similar to those which preceded the overthrow of the government last year, have been renewed in Argentina, it was revealed today.
docs.abstract: Student disturbances; Foreign Min E Bosch resigns

headline.main: ARGENTINE STUDENTS IN CLASH WITH POLICE; Demonstrators Call for President to Quit--Foreign Minister Resigns His Post.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 9.-- The Argentine city of Rosario reports an arrangement between the street car company and provincial authorities whereby service will not be suspended as threatened.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 9.-- The Argentine city of Rosario reports an arrangement between the street car company and provincial authorities whereby service will not be suspended as threatened.
docs.abstract: Agreement reached between street car co and city authorities

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Oct. 9.--The Senate passed a bill today authorizing the government to purchase and distribute 30,000 tons of gasoline and kerosene, and authorizing the Bank of the Republic to open credits of $1,000,000 for such a purchase.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Oct. 9.--The Senate passed a bill today authorizing the government to purchase and distribute 30,000 tons of gasoline and kerosene, and authorizing the Bank of the Republic to open credits of $1,000,000 for such a purchase.

headline.main: URUGUAY TO BUY OIL.; Bill for Government Project Is Outcome of Soviet Offer.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Both credit and collection conditions in Latin-American markets show discouraging developments in the quarterly survey complied yesterday by the foreign credit interchange bureau of the National Association of Credit Men. Mexico and Chile suffer...
docs.lead_paragraph: Both credit and collection conditions in Latin-American markets show discouraging developments in the quarterly survey complied yesterday by the foreign credit interchange bureau of the National Association of Credit Men. Mexico and Chile suffer severe setbacks in the index, with Mexico rated at the bottom in both collections and credit.

headline.main: CREDIT INDEX RECEDES FOR LATIN AMERICA; Survey by Bureau Here Shows Discouraging Setbacks in Quarterly Collections.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Oct. 10.--The Uruguayan Chamber of Deputies this morning passed a bill already passed by the Senate establishing an obligatory moratorium on commercial obligations in foreign currency until Dec. 31, after which such obligations will be...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Oct. 10.--The Uruguayan Chamber of Deputies this morning passed a bill already passed by the Senate establishing an obligatory moratorium on commercial obligations in foreign currency until Dec. 31, after which such obligations will be payable at the rate of 20 per cent monthly until the end of May.
docs.abstract: Bill passed declaring moratorium on commercial obligations in foreign currency

headline.main: MORATORIUM LAW PASSED IN URUGUAY; Payment of Commercial Debts in Foreign Money Banned-- Bank Demands Cut. DUTIES PARTLY DUE IN GOLD New Measure Is Designed to Reduce Imports--Does Not Aim at Us, as Earlier Act Did.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Oct.11.--Argentina has displaced the United States as the principal supplier of Uruguay's imports in the last two months and Russia's exports to Uruguay are double the amount up to the same date of last year, according to official ...

headline.main: ARGENTINE EXPORTS TO URUGUAY IN LEAD; United States Displaced in Last Two Months as Principal Supplier of That Market.RUSSIA DOUBLES SALESBut Decline In Uruguay's Imports Falls to Balance Trade--Business Calls a One-Day Strike.
